page.title: 05INDUSTRIAL LANDSCAPES
page.content: To the west of Normanton lies one of the largest areas of devastation in the country,it occupies the former site of STJohns and Park Hill Collieries.The river Calder meanders through this area of spoil heaps,washlands,worked out Brickworks and dissused colliery railways.West Yorkshire county council have put forward a 40 million pound landfill and reclamation scheme for the Welbeck area.There will be a direct route for colliery waste from Sharlston pit to the area,a new road will be built for this purpose which passes beneath the A655 and crosses the Normanton Wakefield railway line.The River Calder will be diverted and shortened, special lagoons for 50 year floods will be created. New landforms with grass and wooded slopes will replace spoil heaps.
